text: Silver(I) carbonate is a chemical compound. Its chemical formula is Ag2CO3. It contains silver in its +1 oxidation state. It also contains carbonate ions. == Properties == It is a yellow solid. It reacts with acids to make carbon dioxide and a silver(I) salt. It does not dissolve in water. == Preparation == It is made by reacting sodium carbonate with silver nitrate. == Uses == It is used as a catalyst. == Safety == Silver compounds can irritate skin. If consumed, they may turn the skin blue. == Related pages == *Silver oxide *Silver chloride Category:Silver compounds
title: Silver(I) carbonate
